citations.narrative:
On 27 July 2025 a 5-week-old cavapoo puppy born 19 June 2025 was found dead in the adjacent enclosure when the
facility representatives returned home for the evening. The puppy had escaped its primary enclosure and entered the
adjacent enclosure of an adult dog. The puppy was found dead in the adjacent enclosure due to injuries sustained by the
adult dog. The facility representative stated they believe the puppy was able to slip through the gaps between the bars
that act as the wall separating adjacent enclosures in the outdoor section of the sheltered housing facility. The adult dog
has since been moved to a different section of the kennel away from any enclosures that are currently housing puppies.
Enclosures which do not contain animals safely and securely can result in fighting, injuries, and even death to the dogs.
The licensee must ensure housing facilities for dogs must be designed and constructed so they are structurally sound.
They must be kept in good repair, contain the animals securely, and restrict other animals from entering.
Correct from this day going forward 28 July 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.1(a)  Critical
   
Housing facilities, general. 
On 27 July 2025 a 5-week-old cavapoo puppy born 19 June 2025 was found dead in the adjacent enclosure when the 
facility representatives returned home for the evening. The puppy had escaped its primary enclosure and entered the 
adjacent enclosure of an adult dog. The puppy was found dead in the adjacent enclosure due to injuries sustained by the 
adult dog. The facility representative stated they believe the puppy was able to slip through the gaps between the bars 
that act as the wall separating adjacent enclosures in the outdoor section of the sheltered housing facility. The adult dog 
has since been moved to a different section of the kennel away from any enclosures that are currently housing puppies.  
 
Enclosures which do not contain animals safely and securely can result in fighting, injuries, and even death to the dogs. 
The licensee must ensure housing facilities for dogs must be designed and constructed so they are structurally sound. 
They must be kept in good repair, contain the animals securely, and restrict other animals from entering. 
 
Correct from this day going forward 28 July 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
